alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:46AM EST until March 03 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River. White River. .Multiple rounds of recent precipitation, preceded by snow melt, continue to keep minor flooding ongoing along much of the East Fork White, lower White and Wabash rivers. Moderate flooding is occurring on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel. The crest on the Wabash River is past Mount Carmel, the crest on the White River is past Hazleton, and the crest on the East Fork White River is near Shoals. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is expected to last as long as about March 8. The East Fork White river is expected to remain in flood until about March 3. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, During the late March 2008 flood, the Bedford Times reported the following county roads still under water: River Road, Bartlettsville Road by the bridge and in the bottoms, Judah-Logan Road by the bridge, the gravel part of Logan Bottoms, Donica Church Road between Logan Bottoms and the hill, Peerless Road by Mica Metals, Little Salt Creek Run, Stumphole Bridge Road near SR 450, Huron-Williams Road, Lawrenceport Road, Rivervale Road and Earl Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Tuesday was 26.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday morning and continue falling to 7.7 feet Friday, March 11. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1100 PM EST /1000 PM CST/.
